intro: Mesua nagassarium var. coromandeliana, commonly known as the Coromandel flame of the woods, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is evergreen, with glossy, lance-shaped leaves that provide a lush backdrop to its vibrant blossoms.
